Key Match Events: India made 410-4 with Shreyas making 128 not out off 94 balls
KL Rahul scored the fastest World Cup century for India off 62 balls
Shreyas Iyer and KL Rahul shared 208 off 128 for the fourth wicket
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma: 'Everybody wants to take responsibility'

Rohit Sharma: 'We're very pleased with how we played in these nine games. We've been very clinical from game one until today. That's because different individuals have stepped up at different points.'

Scott Edwards: 'I think we played two really good games of cricket in the tournament and gave ourselves opportunities in other games. It's tricky to say where we were compared to where we wanted to be.'
Scott Edwards: 'We are pretty confident with the style we play. We knew it was going to be a tough tournament. We have a lot to get better at ahead of the T20 World Cup next year.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: India win by 160 runs in Bengaluru to complete perfect group stage
Others: India's attention - and ours - now turns to the first semi-final which takes place on Wednesday against New Zealand
Prakash Wakankar: 'This is an India team which looks comfortable in their own skin. They have progressed easily and now it's a question if they can put two games together at the highest intensity.'
Henry Moeran: 'The result was never in doubt after India won the toss.'
Alex Hartley: 'India were clinical. New Zealand will have nothing to lose in the semi-final and must approach it in that way.'
India were always favourites going in to this encounter and it felt ominous when they won the toss and chose to bat first.
